Text:
Cid, so sorry to ask you over so suddenly. And thank
you for coming.

Ohh...er, it's fine, not a problem... If you should
call on me, I will gladly appear by your side at
any time indeed. Ha...hahaha...

That morning, Iris—the strongest swordwoman in the
kingdom—enlisted the help of Claire to summon Cid...
Your smile is twitching.
Huh? Oh, well, it's just because I'm nervous...

You needn't cover for yourself. I am aware that there
are some ill feelings between yourself and the Knight
Order of Midgar Kingdom.

After all...when Alexia was kidnapped, the Knight
Order and those associated with it caused you
a lot of strife.

One of the reasons why I summoned you here today was
because I wished to atone for that.
Atone? But you don't have to—

It is rather difficult for a royal to apologize
publicly to a son of a baron, but please...
Let me apologize to you as a private citizen.
Cid Kageno, I am truly sorry for what happened.

Ugh! Whoa, um, please stop bowing. If my sister finds
out that you apologized to me, Your High—er, Princess
Iris—she'll be very angry with me.
Claire will be...angry with you?
Yes, she seems to hold you in high regard.

I have heard tales of her excellence. I admire her
bold personality and devotion to her family.

And though she is currently still in school—and
therefore, still a knight-in-training—I would feel
honored to have her serve me once she is
officially ordained.

Wow, I don't know what to make of that...it sounds
pretty grand. Well, I'm sure Claire would be happy
to hear that.

And when that day comes, will you be by Alexia's
side?
Um...what?

From what I hear, you two are quite friendly with
each other at school. That your friendship
transcends the gender barrier.

Um, with all due respect...are you sure that wasn't
an over-dramatization?!

Yes, but I have heard that Alexia calls you by a
special nickname.

Ahh. Well, I couldn't exactly call it a nickname.
If anything, it's more like a—

I've also heard that you two play ball together.
Or were those false reports?

Um, she wasn't throwing a ball...oh, uh, never mind.
Whatever...

Well, that is good to hear. So it is true that you
two are friendly with each other.
Yeah... Sure, let's go with that!

So, as I stated earlier, one of the reasons why I
summoned you here was so that I could deliver
an apology. As for the other reason, please
hear me out.
Sure...

I want you to, um...tell me how you perceive Alexia
to be when she is at school.
Can you...elaborate?

I am ashamed to admit this, but I have been unable to
nurture a close relationship with my sister like you
have with yours.

However, I wish to do what I can now to repair our
rocky relationship of the past several years. I wish
to build a harmonious, mutually-supportive
relationship with her.

Those are the kind of sisters I would like us to
become. So, could I ask for your cooperation
in this matter?
My...cooperation?

By speaking with you, Cid, someone who is friendly
with Alexia, I was hoping I could attain some clues
on how to go about nurturing a good relationship
with her.

To that end, I wish for you to tell me what Alexia is
like in her daily life.
In her daily life...

For example, what kind of things do you talk about
on campus?
Well, um, we talk about...d-dogs, I guess.
You talk about...um, dogs?

Yes, like, how it's fun to throw sticks and have them
play fetch...just stuff like that.
I see...is there anything else?

Is there anything else...well, she's not much of
a talker...she'd much rather move around than
sit still.

I think when she has a day off, she likes to go off
campus...or maybe she doesn't...
Which is it?

Well, she does it all incognito, so I can't expose
her secrets...

Ah, I see... I suppose there are some secrets of hers
that you cannot divulge even to me, her elder sister.

Though I did wish to know about my sister's life in
greater detail, it does please me that you two seem
to share such a deep trust.
Well, it's not that special...
Again with the modesty.
Heehee! Perhaps that is what Alexia likes about you.
...I am not sure.
(Perhaps he is just shy from my praise?)

Well, Cid, have you ever accompanied her on any of
her aforementioned incognito outings?
Huh?!

Don't worry, I don't mean to accuse you of dragging
the princess of a nation around against her will.
So...what's your answer?

If I said I haven't gone on outings with her...that
would be a lie.

Well, all we really did was hang out in the market
in the capital.
You hung...out?
How...how does one perform such actions?!

Huh?! Er, how, you ask? Well, you just, you know,
do what most people do...

You follow your nose to find nice places to eat, and
if you see something that catches your eye, you go
into the store to look at the merchandise.

You look at the merchandise? You mean, she doesn't
buy anything?

Well...yes, I guess she doesn't buy anything ever.
So it sometimes feels like it's all a big tease.

When she dragged me—that is, when we walked 
from one end of the market all the way to the
other, it was pretty brutal.

From one end to the other! Perhaps, then, Alexia was
conducting some sort of inspection.

In order to understand how the commoners live,
one mustn't rely solely on official reports. One
must see it with one's own eyes. Is that not so?

W-Well, yeahhh?! I'm not really sure that was her
reasoning...I think this is kinda outside of my
area of expertise.
Is that so...
Um...Princess?
Cid...do you have time tomorrow?
Um...what?

It's just, your words have made me think...
I probably have insufficient imagination
and experience. I'm having a difficult
time grasping what you are saying.

So, in order to understand Alexia's way of thinking,
I have deemed it necessary for me to take the same
actions as her.
Ah-hah...so that's where this is going...

To that end, I wish to go out in the capital as well! 
Would you come with me, Cid?
You mean me?!

You are the only other person who knows what Alexia's
incognito excursions entail.
Don't worry, you can say no...so, what do you think?

B-But surely there're people out there more qualified
than me...
Well, what do you think?
U-Urk...

Iris means no harm. And, appearances aside, she does
not intend to wield her royal authority to intimidate him
into saying yes.

Her intentions are pure—she just wants to retrace the
actions of her little sister and is asking her friend for
help. That is all.

But from Cid's perspective, he can only see Iris's
proposal as something he can not refuse—and
that his sister's future is riding on it.
Ahh...sure. I can do it.
Heehee, thank you. You needn't be so nervous.

Just relax. Think of me the same way you would of
Alexia during an outing.

Deducing that Cid is nervous, Iris says this warmly,
with a royal smile.
